availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Livingston County } Sct

D W Owen States that on the 25th day of July 1864 Furtnan Fife wilfully and maliciously Shot at and killed R Newman, in Livingston County State of Kentucky, That said Furtnan Fife is now under an arrest by the Sheriff of Pope County State of Illinois under charge of selling liquor with out licenses and is being conveyed to The Jail of Massack County State of Illinois for safe keeping

State of Kentucky
Livingston County } Sct
Subscribed and sworn to before me by D W Owen This 26th day of July 1864
J. T. Handlin P J L C

Livingston Co
Illinois
Requisition issued & D W Owen appt. Agent
1st August /64
